tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE book_reviews (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  book_title VARCHAR(255),
  reader_name VARCHAR(255),
  rating INT,
  review_text TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE reviews (
    review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    book_id INT REFERENCES books(book_id),
    reader_id INT,
    rating INT,
    review_text TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE reviews (
  review_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  book_id INT REFERENCES books(book_id),
  reader_id INT REFERENCES readers(reader_id),
  rating FLOAT,
  review_text TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE books (
  book_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  title VARCHAR(255),
  author VARCHAR(255),
  genre VARCHAR(100),
  publication_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE readers (
  reader_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(100),
  email VARCHAR(255),
  dob DATE,
  location VARCHAR(255)
);
CREATE TABLE books (book_id INT PRIMARY KEY, title VARCHAR(255), author VARCHAR(255), genre VARCHAR(50))
CREATE TABLE readers (reader_id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), age INT, city VARCHAR(50))
CREATE TABLE reviews (review_id INT PRIMARY KEY, book_id INT, reader_id INT, rating INT, review_text TEXT)
CREATE TABLE ratings (rating_id INT PRIMARY KEY, book_id INT, reader_id INT, stars INT)

CREATE TABLE reviews (
    review_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    book_id UUID NOT NULL,
    reader_id UUID NOT NULL,
    rating INT NOT NULL,
    comment TEXT,
    review_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE books (
    book_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    author VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    genre VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    publication_date DATE,
    isbn VARCHAR(13) UNIQUE NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE readers (
    reader_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    birthdate DATE,
    subscription_status BOOLEAN DEFAULT false
);
